sen.j: 平安博物館（へいあんはくぶつかん、英称：Heian Museum of Ancient History)は、かつて存在した日本の博物館。
sen.e: Heian Museum of Ancient History is a Japanese museum that once existed.
The Heian Museum of Ancient History was a museum that once existed Japan.
sen.cmt: ナチュラルに翻訳し直し
sen.e: The Heian Museum of Ancient History was a museum that once existed Japan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 財団法人古代学協会の特設機関として、1967年（昭和42年）から1988年（昭和63年）まで存続した。
sen.e: It existed from 1967 to 1988 as a special institution of THE PALEOLOGICAL ASSOCIATION OF JAPAN, Inc..
sen.cmt: THE PALEOLOGICAL ASSOCIATION OF JAPAN, Inc.（データベースより抜粋）→PALEOLOGICALという単語が存在しないようなのですがとりあえず現状のままとしています。
sen.e: It operated from 1967 to 1988 as a special institution of The Paleological Association of Japan, Inc.
sen.cmt: ・「existed」→「operated」・「THE PALEOLOGICAL ASSOCIATION OF JAPAN, Inc..」→「The Paleological Association of Japan, Inc.」
sen.e: It operated from 1967 to 1988 as a special institution of The Paleological Association of Japan, Inc.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 所在地は、京都府京都市中京区三条通高倉上ル菱屋町。
sen.e: The location was 高倉上ル菱屋町, Sanjo-dori Street, Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 高倉上ル菱屋町→表記不明のため原文のままとしています。
sen.e: It was located in Takakura-agaru Hishiya-cho, Sanjo-dori Street, Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: ・「The location was」→「It was located in」・「高倉上ル菱屋町」→「Takakura-agaru Hishiya-cho」
sen.e: It was located in Takakura-agaru Hishiya-cho, Sanjo-dori Street, Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 館長は歴史学者の角田文衞。
sen.e: The president was a historian, Bunei TSUNODA.
Its curator was the historian Bunei TSUNODA.
sen.cmt: ・「The president」→「Its curator」・「a historian,」→「the historian」
sen.e: Its curator was the historian Bunei TSUNODA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 本館は辰野金吾とその弟子長野宇平治が設計した。
sen.e: The museum was designed by Kingo TATSUNO, and his disciple, Uheiji NAGANO.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The museum was designed by Kingo TATSUNO and his apprentice, Uheiji NAGANO.
sen.cmt: ・コンマを削除・「disciple」→「apprentice」
sen.e: The museum was designed by Kingo TATSUNO and his apprentice, Uheiji NAGANO.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1906年（明治39年）に竣工した旧日本銀行京都支店の建物を利用していた。
sen.e: It was originally the building of the old Bank of Japan Kyoto Branch which was built in 1906.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It was originally the building of the Kyoto Branch of the former Bank of Japan which was completed in 1906.
sen.cmt: 原文を反映するように翻訳し直し
sen.e: It was originally the building of the Kyoto Branch of the former Bank of Japan which was completed in 1906.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 英称を直訳すると「平安古代史博物館」となる通り、平安時代を中心とする古代史の専門博物館である。
sen.e: As it is indicated in its English name, it was the museum which devoted exclusively to the ancient history mainly including the Heian period.
As indicated by its English name, it was a museum specializing in ancient history with a focus on the Heian period.
sen.cmt: 原文を反映するように翻訳し直し
sen.e: As indicated by its English name, it was a museum specializing in ancient history with a focus on the Heian period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 研究を重視する「研究博物館」として日本の博物館の中では異色の存在であった。
sen.e: It was a unique museum as the `Research Museum' that focused on research, which was unusual for a Japanese museum.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The museum was unique in Japan for its focus on research.
sen.cmt: 原文を反映するように翻訳し直し
sen.e: The museum was unique in Japan for its focus on research.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 専門職員に対しても通常の博物館のような学芸員ではなく、大学と同様の教授・助教授・講師 (教育)・助手 (教育)の職階を与えていた。
sen.e: shokkai (job ranking) system; professor, associate professor, lecturer (education), assistant (education), like the system in a university was applied to the staff members in the museum.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: shokkai (job ranking) system; professor, associate professor, lecturer (education), assistant (education), like the system in a university was applied to the staff members in the museum.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: shokkai (job ranking) system; professor, associate professor, lecturer (education), assistant (education), like the system in a university was applied to the staff members in the museum.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 展示は、第１室「始源時代室」、第２室「平安京遷都前の山城」、第３室「平安の都」、中央ホール「清凉殿」、第４室「平安文学と生活の部屋」、第５室「紫女の部屋」に分かれていた。
sen.e: There were five exhibition rooms; the first room `primordial period room,' the second room `Yamashiro region before the transfer of national capital to the city of Heian-kyo room,' the third room `Heian capital,' the central hall `seiryo palace,' the fourth room `Heian literature and life room,' the fifth room `purple lady room.'

Exhibits were displayed in the Room 1 - 'Primordial Period', Room 2 - 'Yamashiro Prior to the Transfer of the capital Heian-kyo City', Room 3 - 'The Heian Capital', the Central Hall - 'Seiryoden Hall' Room 4 - 'Heian Literature and Life', and Room - 'Lady Murasaki'.
sen.cmt: ナチュラルに翻訳し直し
sen.e: Exhibits were displayed in the Room 1 - 'Primordial Period', Room 2 - 'Yamashiro Prior to the Transfer of the capital Heian-kyo City', Room 3 - 'The Heian Capital', the Central Hall - 'Seiryoden Hall' Room 4 - 'Heian Literature and Life', and Room 5 - 'Lady Murasaki'.
sen.cmt: 5を追加

sen.j: ことに、中央ホールには平安宮内裏清凉殿の弘徽殿上御局の実物大復元模型が置かれており、平安博物館のシンボルとなっていた。
sen.e: In the central hall, a full-size restored model of Kokiden no Ue no Mitsubone chamber of seiryo-palace in Dairi (the Emperor's residential compound) in Heian-kyu palace was exhibited, which was the symbol of the Heian Museum of Ancient History.

In the central hall, a full-size reconstruction of the Kokiden Imperial Apartment at Seiryoden Hall in the Heian Imperial Palace was exhibited, which was the symbol of the Heian Museum of Ancient History.
sen.cmt: ・「restored model」→「reconstruction」・「Kokiden no Ue no Mitsubone chamber」→「the Kokiden Imperial Apartment」・「at」・「seiryo-palace」→「Seiryoden Hall」・「the」を追加・「Dairi (the Emperor's residential compound) in Heian-kyu palace」→「dairi (Imperial Palace」
sen.e: In the central hall, a full-size reconstruction of the Kokiden Imperial Apartment at Seiryoden Hall in the Heian Imperial Palace was exhibited, which was the symbol of the Heian Museum of Ancient History.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 代表的な所蔵品としては、源氏物語の最良の写本と評価されている大島本（青表紙本）（重要文化財）があった。
sen.e: The famous collection was Oshima-bon manuscript (Aobyoshi-bon group) (important cultural property) that is assessed as a manuscript of the Tale of Genjiin in the best condition.
The museum's most well-known piece was the Oshimabon (Aobyoshibon) manuscript (Important Cultural Property) of "Tale of Genji" which is recognized as the best surviving example.
sen.cmt: ナチュラルに翻訳し直し
sen.e: The museum's most well-known piece was the Oshimabon (Aobyoshibon) manuscript (Important Cultural Property) of "Tale of Genji" which is recognized as the best surviving example.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 京都府の新博物館建設計画に協力するため、その土地・建物を京都府に譲渡して閉館した。
sen.e: It was closed to cooperate with Kyoto Prefecture for a new museum construction plan, and its land and building were assigned to Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The museum was closed to cooperate with a new Kyoto Prefecture museum construction plan, and its land and building were transferred to Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: ・「It」→「The museum」・「Kyoto Prefecture for a new museum construction plan」→「new Kyoto Prefecture museum construction plan」・「assigned」→「transferred」
sen.e: The museum was closed to cooperate with a new Kyoto Prefecture museum construction plan, and its land and building were transferred to Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 京都府はその跡地に京都文化博物館を建設した。
sen.e: Kyoto Prefecture constructed the Museum of Kyoto in the place where Heian Museum of Ancient History was.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Kyoto Prefecture constructed the Museum of Kyoto on the site where the Heian Museum of Ancient History once stood.
sen.cmt: ・「in the place」→「on the site」・「the」を追加・「was」→「once stood」
sen.e: Kyoto Prefecture constructed the Museum of Kyoto on the site where the Heian Museum of Ancient History once stood.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 財団法人古代学協会は、平安博物館の後継機関として京都文化博物館別館（旧・平安博物館本館）内に古代学研究所を開設した。
sen.e: THE PALEOLOGICAL ASSOCIATION OF JAPAN, Inc. established the Ancient History Institute within the Museum of Kyoto Annex (the former Heian Museum of Ancient History, main building) as a successive institute of Heian Museum of Ancient History.
sen.cmt: THE PALEOLOGICAL ASSOCIATION OF JAPAN, Inc.（データベースより抜粋）→PALEOLOGICALという単語が存在しないようなのですがとりあえず現状のままとしています。古代学研究所→定訳不明ですが暫定的に→the Ancient History Institute と訳出しています。
sen.e: The Paleological Association of Japan, Inc. established the Ancient History Institute within the Museum of Kyoto Annex (the former main building of the Heian Museum of Ancient History) as a successor institute of Heian Museum of Ancient History.
sen.cmt: ・「THE PALEOLOGICAL ASSOCIATION OF JAPAN, Inc..」→「The Paleological Association of Japan, Inc.」・「Heian Museum of Ancient History, main building」→「main building of the Heian Museum of Ancient History」・「successive」→「successor」
sen.e: The Paleological Association of Japan, Inc. established the Ancient History Institute within the Museum of Kyoto Annex (the former main building of the Heian Museum of Ancient History) as a successor institute of Heian Museum of Ancient History.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
